admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia

abstracts.cdata!:
The Kayraktepe Hydropower Project will
            support the Governments strategy of developing Turkey's
            energy resources, through financing a 420 MW hydropower
            station on the Goksu river in Southern Turkey. The plant
            will generate around 990 GWh per year of electric energy, it
            will also help protect the rich Silifke plain and the city
            of Silifke from possible floods. In addition the project
            will provide technical assistance to DSI (State Hydraulic
            Authority) in cost accounting, and to MENR (Ministry of
            Energy and Natural Resources) in carrying out a national
            ranking of hydroelectric resources.
